intro: Celsia longirostris var. hoggarica, commonly known as the Hoggar celsia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the arid regions of the Hoggar Mountains in Algeria. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with small, lanceolate leaves that are adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
